items.title: Live: CIA advised Trump to leave Maduro's deputy in power in Caracas
items.description: As Nicolás Maduro and his wife face court in New York after being captured by US forces, House Democrats leader Hakeem Jeffries has accused US President Donald Trump of lying to the American people about the reason for the attack. Follow live.

items.title: Trump attack on Greenland would mean end of NATO, says Danish leader
items.description: Military intervention in Venezuela has reignited fears about US President Donald Trump's designs on the autonomous Danish territory.

items.title: Trump's bombs were as much an attack on China as they were on Venezuela
items.description: Venezuela has spent years getting cosier with China. Now Donald Trump is sending a clear warning to Beijing — get out of his backyard.

items.title: Man arrested in connection to alleged Hanukkah car arson in Melbourne
items.description: A man has been arrested in connection to an alleged arson attack on a vehicle with a Hanukkah decoration on Christmas morning in Melbourne's south-east.

items.title: Tributes flow for National Party stalwart after death at home overnight
items.description: Known as "Bozzie" to his mates and colleagues, Mr Boswell's political career spanned three decades.

items.title: Live: Khawaja gets hero's welcome for last Test after Head finally falls at SCG
items.description: Usman Khawaja strides to the crease after Travis Head falls for 163 as Australia piles on the runs on day three of the fifth Ashes Test at the SCG. Follow live.

items.title: Live: ASX runs out of steam despite Wall Street rally
items.description: Australian shares retreat into into the red, while steel producer BlueScope gains 20 per cent on a takeover tilt. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: BlueScope shares rocket higher on $13 billion Stokes bid
items.description: Kerry Stokes-controlled firm SGH has launched a $13.2 billion takeover bid for BlueScope Steel, in partnership with a US steelmaker.

items.title: EU, Britain condemn sexualised deepfake images spreading on X
items.description: A digital undressing spree on Elon Musk's social media site has prompted investigations from countries including France, India and Malaysia.

items.title: Doctors slam US cut to vaccines recommended for children
items.description: The US government takes the unprecedented step of cutting the number of vaccines it recommends for every child, a move long sought by Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr. But medical groups say it undermines protections against diseases.

items.title: LA-like fires could hit Australian capital cities, report warns
items.description: Australia's capital cities are increasingly at risk of being affected by a major fire like the one that ravaged Los Angeles last year, according to a new climate report.

items.title: 'Boomer' dad and daughter join Sloane's shadow cabinet
items.description: The opposition leader says she does not consider the gender breakdown of her shadow ministry, which has 16 men and 10 women.

items.title: Farmer considers selling up because of red tape on hosting campers
items.description: A Scenic Rim farmer says the costs of getting a council permit to host campers are so high he may have to sell his property.

items.title: SA MP charged for alleged assault released on bail with ankle monitor
items.description: South Australian independent MP Nick McBride has been granted release on strict home detention bail conditions — including wearing an ankle monitor — after spending 10 days behind bars for an alleged assault against his wife.

items.title: Ominous graffiti revealed as police probe 2012 disappearance of WA man
items.description: Fourteen years after Charlie Park disappeared in regional WA, detectives have reopened the case and are calling for information from the community.

items.title: Aboriginal mother of five identified after death in NT police watch house
items.description: A Sydney-based law firm says it is representing the family of a 44-year-old Aboriginal woman who died in custody at the Tennant Creek police watch house.

items.title: Serial fraudster allegedly targeting pet and home owners in scam
items.description: Dozens of people from multiple states have come forward after allegedly falling victim to a new pet and house-sitting scam orchestrated by career con artist Patricia McIntyre.

items.title: Crowdfunding efforts help cover $50K vet bill for cat burnt in bushfire
items.description: Sassy the cat was almost killed when a bushfire razed a Koolewong home on NSW's Central Coast. Now, the lucky pet is being reunited with her family.

items.title: Rebel tree planters' work removed after beachfront poisonings
items.description: A Queensland council is being criticised for uprooting unauthorised saplings from sand dunes amid a long-running vegetation battle.

items.title: Djokovic withdraws from Australian Open lead-up event in Adelaide
items.description: With the Australian Open on the horizon, Novak Djokovic does not feel he is well enough prepared to contest next week's Adelaide International.

items.title: How a 'ruthless' energy company went after a pensioner for money he didn't owe
items.description: Australia's energy prices continue to soar as questions continue to be raised about the actions of providers, including by this pensioner who was overcharged and then had debt collectors chasing him.

items.title: Is Tasmania's 'red tide' a brilliant light show or an environmental problem?
items.description: Scientists say a bioluminescent algae causes the red tides at the centre of recent environmentalist concerns — but that's not to say the magnificent display is totally harmless to marine life.

items.title: Dragons sign star Rabbitohs forward on massive five-year deal
items.description: Dragons supporters will have to wait until 2027 to see Keaon Koloamatangi wearing the Red V, but the club describes his signing as the "biggest" in their recent history.

items.title: Prominent Labor figures join calls for antisemitism royal commission
items.description: A group of former Labor MPs, senators and party officials have signed an open letter asking Anthony Albanese to call a national royal commission into the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: A 70-year age gap is no barrier to friendship in this town
items.description: In a country town near Canberra, a program run by an aged care provider and the local high school is seeing positive results in breaking down barriers between younger and older community members.
